fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An Opinion piece said that the housing association Genesis would now only build homes for sale, and would sell off vacant properties. After a proposed merger with Thames Valley Housing Association, Genesis plans to stop building homes for social rent, but will continue to build for affordable and market rent, as well as shared ownership and full market sale. Vacant homes will be reviewed and some may be sold (Housing is the next target in Cameron’s war on welfare, 10 November, page 37). • We had the wrong Star Trek character when we referred to the presence among the crew of the Enterprise of “a Scot called McCoy”. Dr McCoy was American; the Scottish character was the chief engineer Montgomery “Scotty” Scott (How the starship Enterprise and its crew lived long and prospered, 7 November, page 15). • In an article about the phasing out of pantry cars on Indian railways, we overstated their output in saying their workers had “toiled over many decades to provide trillions of meals to billions of passengers”. But they have, over the years, provided billions of meals to passengers (Indian railways’ new line: e-catering instead of pantry cars, 6 November, page 26).
